text: This bottled Sake from a bottle shop poured a extremely small sized head of frothy medium sized clear colored bubbles that were very quickly diminishing and left behind a uncarbonated transparent clear colored body and no lacing. The strong aroma was green apple musty and mild vinous. The mildly vinous clean mouth feel was weakly tingly at the start and strongly tingly at the finish with a lingering vinous aftertaste. The balanced flavor contained notes of polished rice and vinous. A decent one that I would consider drinking again.
Bottle while enjoying some curling on tv. Pours light olive juice with light melon nose. Tastes of light olive brine, honey dew, pears, and almonds. Alcohol is faint. And creamy mouthfeel.
Rated in 2010 (Backlog) - Clear with OK legs. Aroma is of floral, light buter, and berries. Taste is of booze with a sweet rice finish.
Thanks to bman1113vr from way back. The look is clear, no color, decent legs. The smell is almonds, sweet, rice,and ok. The taste is rice, almond, and sweet.

Bottle. No head (still). Body is colorless. Aroma is notes of potato, grain/rice, glue, alcohol. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Medium body, watery texture, no carbonation, moderately to heavily alcoholic, lightly astringent. Pretty bad...typical cheap sake odors with some raw potato to boot.  Not much to balance the sweetness, watery texture, and a hot/burning finish.  The only thing nice about it is the bottle it comes in, sadly.  Swill sake despite the price.

(300ml, bottle 01/2010, courtesy of BMan1113VR)  Pours a transparent body with descent legs.  Aroma of almond, alcohol, and rice milk.  Flavor of almond and light florals.  Not much character or complexity.

(300ml bottled 1-10 thanks to BMan1113VR) clear, coats the glass with excellent alcohol legs. Nose of soft white peaches, nice alcohol burn, sweetness, cooked white rice. Taste of subtle fusels, sweet rice, mango with a slick medium to light dry body and a hot finish.

Thanks to bman1113vr for sharing this bottle. Very clear with some bubbles. The aroma is alcohol and rice with some citrus and floral notes. The flavor is more of the same with the citrus and alcohol standing out.
bottle thanks to bman1113vr.  clear with no head.  nose is very floral, almonds, and alcohol.  nice on the palate, flavor is almonds, alcohol, and more florals.

Bottle marked as bottled on 10/01 (January 2010). Pours with a clear body with strong legs. Aroma of koji, cherry, alcohol, dry and delicate, pear and anise. Taste is hard to get many descriptors from. Medium sweet, not exceptionally flavorful. Syrupy body, not much alcohol.
bottle, thanks to bman1113vr, crystal clear with no legs, alcohol and coconut aroma, flavors of creamy vanilla, coconut milk, finish is hot
Little bottle at a Thai restaraunt.  Clear, taste was sharp, sweet and really not my thing.
Bottle.  Aroma is lightly tapiocaish with a bit of pear and melon, but otherwise there isnt a whole lot going on in here.  Light black pepper and a bit of graininess.

Bottled, shared with some folks. Milk koji, olive, corn aroma. Pretty deep, with soy, salt, melon, pine. Very thick mouthfeel, mild melon, black pepper, nice rice in the finish. Very little alcohol noticable. Better than average.

Being the first person to rate a sake makes a tyro like me nervous, but here goes - -  The pour is crystal clear and thin, barely clinging to the sides of the glass.  The aroma is newly mown grassess with a touch of musk melon and the warmth of alcohol.  Its not much thicker than water in the mouth, the alcohol only making its presence known by a light peppery feel on the tongue.  The flavor is more subtle than other sakes that Ive tried, mainly sweet grassess, melon rind, and a suggestion of banana, all warmed by the alcohol.  The finish is fairly dry.  Milder in flavor than most that Ive tasted, I think this sake bears repeating.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Beverage Depot, Orland Park, IL<font size=-1>
